data.meta_description: Complete List of the most important Temples in Karnataka. Get detailed information on Temples in Karnataka including History, Photos, Temple Timings, Puja Schedule, Map, Videos and more.

data.text: The Vittala Temple or Vitthala Temple in Hampi is an ancient monument that is well-known for its exceptional architecture and unmatched craftsmanship. It is considered to be one of the largest and...The Badami cave temples are a complex of four Hindu, Jain and possibly Buddhist cave temples located in Badami, a town in the Bagalkot district in northern part of Karnataka, India. The caves are...Seemanthooru is a small village near Mulki, close to the Mangalore – Udupi Highway. The village is close to the Mulki railway station. The name Seemanthooru is an offshoot of “Shrimantara...Kodandaramaswami Temple is a Hindu shrinelocated at Hiremagalur near Chikkamagaluru, in Chikkamagaluru district, Karnataka, India. The temple deity is called Kodandarama, as Rama, and his brother...Neelavara is a beautiful place located at a distance of 18 Km from Udupi near Brahmavara in Udupi district. Neelavara lies between Kunjal village in the south and River Sita in the north. This...The Chennakesava temple was originally referred to as the Vijayanarayana temple. It is situated on the Yagachi River at Belur. It was previously the capital of the Hoysala rulers. The temple was named...Sri Mookambika Temple is located near the river sauparnika. It is believed that Garuda(Eagle) performed penance on the banks of the river and attained salvation hence river was named as sauparnika.Goravanahalli Mahalakshmi Temple is an extremely popular Mahalakshmi temple location in Tumkur District, Karnataka.
